A Hendiadys is a figure of speech in which two words or phrases are combined to express a single idea, with each word or phrase emphasizing a different aspect of the same concept. The term comes from the Greek words "hendyas" (one) and "didus" (twice), meaning "one twice." This literary device is often used in poetry to create a more vivid and powerful image for the reader.

For example, consider the phrase "a heart full of love and kindness." Here, "love" and "kindness" are combined to express the idea of a person who is not only affectionate but also caring and compassionate. Each word emphasizes a different aspect of the same emotional state, creating a more nuanced and evocative description.
